#### Low-Midlittoral
```{r low-midlittoral}

df2<- read_excel("low-midlittoral-data.xlsx", sheet = 1)
str(df2)

df2$site      <- as.factor(df2$site)
df2$subregion <- as.factor(df2$subregion)
df2$region    <-as.factor(df2$region)

df2 <- df2 %>% 
       mutate_at(c(4:34), as.numeric)

str(df2)

df2_N <- aggregate(CCA ~ site, data = df2, length)
## Check N per site to make sure there are no dummies ##
rm(df2_N)
```

#### Low-Midlittoral: barnacle Tetraclita
```{r barnacle Tetraclita stalactifera}

# Get only Tetraclita coverage and environmental predictors:
tet_data <- subset(df2, select = c(4, 25:31))
tet_data <- as.data.frame(tet_data)
str(tet_data)

# train a default random forest model
  tet_rf1 <- ranger(
  formula = T.stalactifera ~ ., 
  data = tet_data,
  num.trees = 2500,
  importance = "permutation",
  seed = 1238)

print(tet_rf1)
(default_rmse <- sqrt(tet_rf1$prediction.error))# get OOB RMSE for further comparison ##

# create hyperparameter grid
hyper_grid <- expand.grid(
  mtry = c(2:6),
  min.node.size = c(1, 3, 5, 10, 15), 
  replace = c(TRUE, FALSE),                               
  sample.fraction = c(.5, .63, .8),                       
  rmse = NA)

# execute full cartesian grid search
for(i in seq_len(nrow(hyper_grid))) {
  # fit model for ith hyperparameter combination
  fit <- ranger(
    formula         = T.stalactifera ~ ., 
    data            = tet_data, 
    num.trees       = 2500,
    mtry            = hyper_grid$mtry[i],
    min.node.size   = hyper_grid$min.node.size[i],
    replace         = hyper_grid$replace[i],
    sample.fraction = hyper_grid$sample.fraction[i],
    verbose         = FALSE,
    seed            = 123,
    #respect.unordered.factors = F,
  )
  # export OOB error 
  hyper_grid$rmse[i] <- sqrt(fit$prediction.error)
}

# assess top 10 models
hyper_grid %>%
  arrange(rmse) %>%
  mutate(perc_gain = (default_rmse - rmse) / default_rmse * 100) %>%
  head(10)

# re-run model -- as there was no significant improve, go with default parameters ##
tet_rf2 <- ranger(
  formula = T.stalactifera ~ ., 
  data = tet_data, 
  num.trees = 2500,
  mtry = 2,
  min.node.size = 5,
  sample.fraction = .63,
  replace = TRUE,
  importance = "permutation",
  verbose = FALSE,
  seed  = 1238)

print(tet_rf2)
tet_rf2[["variable.importance"]]
vip::vip(tet_rf2, num_features = 10, bar = FALSE)

### Partial plots figs:
tet1 <- tet_rf2 %>%  # the %>% operator is read as "and then"
        partial(pred.var = "sst_mean", grid.resolution = 20) %>%
        autoplot(smooth = TRUE, ylab = "T. stalactifera", xlab = "SST") +
        theme_light() + #ylim(18, 36) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, color="black"), 
        axis.text.y = element_text(size=14, color="black"),
        axis.title.x = element_text(color="black", size=15),
        axis.title.y = element_text(color="black", size=15))+
        ggtitle("")

tet2 <- tet_rf2 %>%  # the %>% operator is read as "and then"
        partial(pred.var = "chla_mean", grid.resolution = 20) %>%
        autoplot(smooth = TRUE, ylab = "T. stalactifera", xlab = "Chla") +
        theme_light() +  #ylim(18, 36) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, color="black"), 
        axis.text.y = element_text(size=14, color="black"),
        axis.title.x = element_text(color="black", size=15),
        axis.title.y = element_text(color="black", size=15))+
        ggtitle("")

tet3 <- tet_rf2 %>%  # the %>% operator is read as "and then"
        partial(pred.var = "fwd_mean", grid.resolution = 20) %>%
        autoplot(smooth = TRUE, ylab = "T. stalactifera", xlab = "FwD") +
        theme_light() + #ylim(18, 36) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, color="black"), 
        axis.text.y = element_text(size=14, color="black"),
        axis.title.x = element_text(color="black", size=15),
        axis.title.y = element_text(color="black", size=15))+
        ggtitle("")

tet4 <- tet_rf2 %>%  # the %>% operator is read as "and then"
        partial(pred.var = "wf_mean", grid.resolution = 20) %>%
        autoplot(smooth = TRUE, ylab = "T. stalactifera", xlab = "WF") +
        theme_light() +  #ylim(18, 36) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, color="black"), 
        axis.text.y = element_text(size=14, color="black"),
        axis.title.x = element_text(color="black", size=15),
        axis.title.y = element_text(color="black", size=15))+
        ggtitle("")

tet5 <- tet_rf2 %>%  # the %>% operator is read as "and then"
        partial(pred.var = "DNC", grid.resolution = 20) %>%
        autoplot(smooth = TRUE, ylab = "T. stalactifera", xlab = "DNC") +
        theme_light() + #ylim(18, 36) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, color="black"), 
        axis.text.y = element_text(size=14, color="black"),
        axis.title.x = element_text(color="black", size=15),
        axis.title.y = element_text(color="black", size=15))+
        ggtitle("")

tet6 <- tet_rf2 %>%  # the %>% operator is read as "and then"
        partial(pred.var = "roughness", grid.resolution = 20) %>%
        autoplot(smooth = TRUE, ylab = "T. stalactifera", xlab = "roughness") +
        theme_light() + #ylim(18, 36) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, color="black"), 
        axis.text.y = element_text(size=14, color="black"),
        axis.title.x = element_text(color="black", size=15),
        axis.title.y = element_text(color="black", size=15))+
        ggtitle("")

tet7 <- tet_rf2 %>%  # the %>% operator is read as "and then"
        partial(pred.var = "incl_mean", grid.resolution = 20) %>%
        autoplot(smooth = TRUE, ylab = "T. stalactifera", xlab = "inclination") +
        theme_light() + #ylim(18, 36) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=14, color="black"), 
        axis.text.y = element_text(size=14, color="black"),
        axis.title.x = element_text(color="black", size=15),
        axis.title.y = element_text(color="black", size=15))+
        ggtitle("")

tet_all <- ggarrange(tet1, tet2, tet3, tet4, tet5, tet6, tet7, ncol = 3, nrow = 3, align = "hv")
tet_all

#ggsave("submission/Ecography/RF_figs/LM/LM-Tetraclita.png", dpi = 300, width = 11.7, height = 8.14, units = "in")

varhandle::rm.all.but(keep = c("df2"), envir=.GlobalEnv, keep_functions = F, gc_limit = 100, regex = "auto")
```

#### Low-Midlittoral: mussel Mytilaster solisianus
```{r mussel M. solisianus}

myt_data <- subset(df2, select = c(5, 25:31))
myt_data <- as.data.frame(myt_data)
str(myt_data)

# train a default random forest model
  myt_rf1 <- ranger(
  formula = M.solisianus ~ ., 
  data = myt_data,
  num.trees = 2500,
  importance = "permutation",
  seed = 4558)

print(myt_rf1)
(default_rmse <- sqrt(myt_rf1$prediction.error))# get OOB RMSE for further comparison ##

# create hyperparameter grid
hyper_grid <- expand.grid(
  mtry = c(2:6),
  min.node.size = c(1, 3, 5, 10, 15), 
  replace = c(TRUE, FALSE),                               
  sample.fraction = c(.5, .63, .8),                       
  rmse = NA)

# execute full cartesian grid search
for(i in seq_len(nrow(hyper_grid))) {
  # fit model for ith hyperparameter combination
  fit <- ranger(
    formula         = M.solisianus ~ ., 
    data            = myt_data, 
    num.trees       = 2500,
    mtry            = hyper_grid$mtry[i],
    min.node.size   = hyper_grid$min.node.size[i],
    replace         = hyper_grid$replace[i],
    sample.fraction = hyper_grid$sample.fraction[i],
    verbose         = FALSE,
    seed            = 123,
    #respect.unordered.factors = F,
  )
  # export OOB error 
  hyper_grid$rmse[i] <- sqrt(fit$prediction.error)}

# assess top 10 models
hyper_grid %>%
  arrange(rmse) %>%
  mutate(perc_gain = (default_rmse - rmse) / default_rmse * 100) %>%
  head(10)

# re-run model -- as there was no significant improve, go with default parameters ##
```

#### Low-Midlittoral: Phragmatopoma sp. (reef-building polychaete)
```{r polychaete Phragmatopoma sp.}

worm_data2 <- subset(df2, select = c(9, 25:31))
worm_data2 <- as.data.frame(worm_data2)

# train a default random forest model
  worm_rf1 <- ranger(
  formula = Phragmatopoma ~ .,

(default_rmse <- sqrt(worm_rf1$prediction.error))# get OOB RMSE for further comparison ##

  mtry = c(2:6),
  min.node.size = c(1, 3, 5, 10, 15),

    replace         = hyper_grid$replace[i],
    sample.fraction = hyper_grid$sample.fraction[i],
    verbose         = FALSE,
    seed            = 1583,
    #respect.unordered.factors = F,
  )
  # export OOB error 
  hyper_grid$rmse[i] <- sqrt(fit$prediction.error)
}

# assess top 10 models
hyper_grid %>%
```

### Low-Midlittoral: mussel Perna perna
```{r mussel P. perna}

perna_data2 <- subset(df2, select = c(7, 25:31))
perna_data2 <- as.data.frame(perna_data2)
str(perna_data2)

# train a default random forest model
  perna_rf1 <- ranger(
  formula = P.perna ~ ., 
  data = perna_data2,
  num.trees = 2500,
  importance = "permutation",
  seed = 1288)

print(perna_rf1)
(default_rmse <- sqrt(perna_rf1$prediction.error))# get OOB RMSE for further comparison ##

# create hyperparameter grid
hyper_grid <- expand.grid(
  mtry = c(2:6),
  min.node.size = c(1, 3, 5, 10, 15), 
  replace = c(TRUE, FALSE),                               
  sample.fraction = c(.5, .63, .8),                       
  rmse = NA)

# execute full cartesian grid search
for(i in seq_len(nrow(hyper_grid))) {
  # fit model for ith hyperparameter combination
  fit <- ranger(
    formula         = P.perna ~ ., 
    data            = perna_data2, 
    num.trees       = 2500,
    mtry            = hyper_grid$mtry[i],
    min.node.size   = hyper_grid$min.node.size[i],
    replace         = hyper_grid$replace[i],
    sample.fraction = hyper_grid$sample.fraction[i],
    verbose         = FALSE,
    seed            = 1253,
    #respect.unordered.factors = F,
  )
  # export OOB error 
  hyper_grid$rmse[i] <- sqrt(fit$prediction.error)
}

# assess top 10 models
hyper_grid %>%
  arrange(rmse) %>%
  mutate(perc_gain = (default_rmse - rmse) / default_rmse * 100) %>%
  head(10)

# re-run model -- as there was no significant improve, go with default parameters ##
perna_rf2 <- ranger(
  formula = P.perna ~ ., 
  data = perna_data2, 
  num.trees = 2500,
  mtry = 2,
  min.node.size = 5,
  sample.fraction = .63,
  replace = T,
  importance = "permutation",
  verbose = FALSE,

)
```

#### Low-Midlittoral: Turf-forming algae
```{r Low-midlittoral turf-forming algae}

## Creating a variable called 'turf' = summing up ACA, CCA, foliose and filamentous algae) ##
df2$turf <- (df2$ACA + df2$filamentous + df2$foliose + df2$CCA)

## sorting data
turf_data <- subset(df2, select = c(35, 25:31))
turf_data <- as.data.frame(turf_data)
str(turf_data)

# train a default random forest model
turf_rf1 <- ranger(turf ~.,
                  data = turf_data,
                  seed = 1143,
                  num.trees = 2500,
                  importance = "permutation")

print(turf_rf1)
(default_rmse <- sqrt(turf_rf1$prediction.error))# get OOB RMSE for further comparison ##

# create hyperparameter grid
hyper_grid <- expand.grid(
  mtry = c(2:6),
  min.node.size = c(1, 3, 5, 10, 15), 
  replace = c(TRUE, FALSE),                               
  sample.fraction = c(.5, .63, .8),                       
  rmse = NA)

# execute full cartesian grid search
for(i in seq_len(nrow(hyper_grid))) {
  # fit model for ith hyperparameter combination
  fit <- ranger(
    formula         = turf ~ ., 
    data            = turf_data, 
    num.trees       = 2500,
    mtry            = hyper_grid$mtry[i],
    min.node.size   = hyper_grid$min.node.size[i],
    replace         = hyper_grid$replace[i],
    sample.fraction = hyper_grid$sample.fraction[i],
    verbose         = FALSE,
    seed            = 1143,
    #respect.unordered.factors = F,
  )
  # export OOB error 
  hyper_grid$rmse[i] <- sqrt(fit$prediction.error)
}

# assess top 10 models
hyper_grid %>%
  arrange(rmse) %>%
  mutate(perc_gain = (default_rmse - rmse) / default_rmse * 100) %>%
  head(10)

# re-run model -- as there was no significant improve, go with default parameters ##
turf_rf2 <- ranger(
  formula = turf ~ ., 
  data = turf_data, 
  num.trees = 2500,
  mtry = 2,
  min.node.size = 5,
  sample.fraction = .63,
  replace = TRUE,
  importance = "permutation",
  verbose = FALSE,
  seed  = 5213)

print(turf_rf2)
turf_rf2[["variable.importance"]]
vip::vip(turf_rf2, num_features = 10, bar = FALSE)
```
